str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
As far as, up to, until, during. Or achris akh'-rece; akin to akron; until or up to.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Today, now. Neuter of a presumed compound of the article ho and hemera; on the day; generally, now.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To harden, make hard, make stubborn. From skleros; to indurate, i.e. render stubborn.
Deceit, deception, deceitfulness, delusion. From apatao; delusion.
